subject: AI
title: Knowledge Cutoff
description: Why models don't know about events after their training date.

hook.text: You ask: 'Who won the 2025 election?' The model answers confidently ‚Äî with information from 2023. Its knowledge has a cutoff date, and it doesn't know what it doesn't know.

buildup.text: Knowledge cutoff: models are trained on data up to a specific date. Events, discoveries, and changes after that date don't exist in the model's knowledge. It's frozen in time.

discovery.text: The dangerous part: the model won't say 'I don't know about that.' It will extrapolate or hallucinate based on pre-cutoff patterns. It might predict an election result based on polling data from months earlier.

twist.text: Web search tools (like Bing in ChatGPT) partially fix this by retrieving current information. But the model still can't reason deeply about post-cutoff events ‚Äî it can only parrot retrieved text.

climax.text: For time-sensitive information: always use RAG or search grounding. Never rely on the model's parametric knowledge for anything that might have changed since training.

punchline.text: The model's knowledge has an expiry date. Always check the label.

quiz.question: What happens when you ask a model about events after its training cutoff?
options: It extrapolates or hallucinates based on pre-cutoff patterns without acknowledging the gap
It gives a perfectly accurate answer
